The provided code chunk demonstrates an example of using `DirectScrolledList` in Panda3D to create a scrollable list interface with customizable properties such as button positions, frame sizing, and item management. The example showcases initializing the widget with specific configurations and dynamically adding items (including buttons and labels) to the list.

incButton_pos=(0.35, 0, -0.02),
    incButton_text="Inc",
    incButton_text_scale=0.04,
    incButton_borderWidth=(0.005, 0.005),

    frameSize=(0.0, 0.7, -0.05, 0.59),
    frameColor=(1,0,0,0.5),
    pos=(-1, 0, 0),
    items=[b1, b2],
    numItemsVisible=numItemsVisible,
    forceHeight=itemHeight,
    itemFrame_frameSize=(-0.2, 0.2, -0.37, 0.11),
    itemFrame_pos=(0.35, 0, 0.4),
)

myScrolledList.addItem(l1)
myScrolledList.addItem(l2)
myScrolledList.addItem(l3)

for fruit in ['apple', 'pear', 'banana', 'orange']:
    l = DirectLabel(text=fruit, text_scale=0.1)
    myScrolledList.addItem(l)

base.run()
